derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: pet form of goodwife; 比较 hussy

entry.def: You can refer to pleasant, exciting, or attractive things as goodies .

example.ex: Birmingham, the 'UK City of Music', will be parading its finest artistic goodies.
example.tran: 英国的音乐之都伯明翰将展示其精美的艺术珍品。

entry.tran: （电影、小说或真实生活中的）正面人物，好人
entry.def: You can refer to the heroes or the morally good characters in a film or story as the goodies. You can also refer to the goodies in a situation in real life.

example.ex: ...the thriller, a genre which depends on goodies and baddies...
example.tran: 惊悚小说，一种依赖于好人和坏人之间矛盾冲突的文学类型

example.ex: There are few goodies and baddies in this industrial dispute.
example.tran: 在这次劳资纠纷中几乎没有绝对的好人与坏人。

entry.tran: （尤为儿童用语，表示高兴或赞许）太好喽
entry.def: People, especially children, say goody in order to express their pleasure or approval of something.

example.tran: 哦，太好喽，我喜欢玩游戏。

means.word_mean: 特别吸引人的东西, 美味的食品

sentences.en: We’re giving away a free goody bag with every children’s meal.
sentences.cn: 每一客儿童餐我们赠送一袋礼品。

means.word_mean: 太好啦(尤指小孩用以表示高兴的用语)
